titleStmt.title: Daniel Donoven to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2228

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Milton, Trimble County, Ky
Oct. 7th/65.
To his Excellency,
Gov Bramlette:

I beg to apprise you that my private duties are such, that I cannot consistently discharge the duties of Magistrate with efficiency, and am constrained to tender to you my resignation of Justice of the Peace in and for Trimble County, Kentucky.
Trusting that you will forward to me at the earliest date, your acceptance of this my Resignation
I would respectfully Represent for your consideration the name of Sanford Kendall Esqr as a Suitable person to fill the office of magistrate

Justice Peace
Resignation of Danl Donoven
accepted
11 Oct/65
